channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Teenage E-Cigarette Use Continues to Decline
item.description: The percentage of middle and high school students reporting that they vaped tobacco products declined to about a third of the peak levels in 2019, a n...

item.title: German Police Shoot Gunman Dead Near Israeli Consulate in Munich
item.description: The shootout with an 18-year-old Austrian came on the anniversary of the attack on the Munich Olympics that left 11 Israelis dead, and was being inves...

item.title: Florida and Texas boomtowns are awash in a glut of condos
item.description: It comes down to skyhigh homeowners association fees and insurance costs, according to an analysis from Redfin.

item.title: Federal Agents Search Homes of N.Y.C. Deputy Mayors and Schools Chief
item.description: The searches do not appear related to the federal investigation into Mayor Eric Adams and his campaign fund-raising, according to people familiar with...

item.title: Surprising New Research Links Infant Mortality to Crashing Bat Populations
item.description: Without bats to eat insects, farmers turned to more pesticides, a study found. That appears to have increased infant deaths.

item.title: The DOJ can’t break up Nvidia party, the stock is staying high, BofA says
item.description: Reports of a possible DOJ inquiry into the chip manufacturer are unlikely to affect the stock—for now.

item.title: When Gambia Banned Female Genital Cutting, a Defiant 96-Year-Old Resisted
item.description: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But h...

item.title: When Gambia Banned Female Genital Cutting, a Defiant 96-Year-Old Resisted
item.description: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But h...

item.title: Bolt CEO: Department stores are rising from the ashes
item.description: To write off department stores entirely would be premature. These institutions have weathered economic storms before.

item.title: Boko Haram Kills at Least 170 Villagers in Nigeria Attack
item.description: Boko Haram killed at least 170 villagers in northeastern Nigeria, community leaders say, in what is likely one of the deadliest attacks in recent year...

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Airstrikes Resume in Central Gaza as Polio Campaign Enters New Phase
item.description: As the first phase of vaccinations ended, an Israeli strike hit a hospital courtyard in central Gaza where people were sheltering, Palestinian news me...

item.title: A musician siphoned $10 million in royalties after using AI to create hundreds of thousands of songs, streaming them billions of times
item.description: Michael Smith, 52, of Cornelius, North Carolina, was arrested on fraud and conspiracy charges. He faces up to 60 years in prison.

item.title: ‘Beetlejuice Beetlejuice’ Review: Delightfully Undead Again
item.description: Tim Burton has brought the band back together — Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder, even Bob the shrunken head guy — for a fun but less edgy sequel.

item.title: Boko Haram Kills at Least 170 Villagers in Nigeria Attack
item.description: Boko Haram killed at least 170 villagers in northeastern Nigeria, community leaders say, in what is likely one of the deadliest attacks in recent year...

item.title: Mars chief reveals his secrets to leadership success: Slow down, learn from failures, embrace feedback
item.description: Anton Vincent, president of Mars North America, underscored the value of constructive feedback in shaping a career.
